description: From Latin exauctoratus, past participle of exauctorare (“to dismiss”), from ex (“out”) + auctorare (“to bind to something, to hire”), from auctor. See author.

verbs.description: exauthorate (third-person singular simple present exauthorates, present participle exauthorating, simple past and past participle exauthorated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To deprive of authority or office; to depose or discharge.
